page.title: 04YEARLSTONE VINEYARD
page.content: A well established vineyard on a south facing slope in the{Exe Valley compares favourably with the classic French and German vineyards.Four wines are made here from{vines}originating in France and Germany. They are grown on old soils and rock in contrast to clay and are therefore well drained. {The site}is also well protected from the North and West winds, and being above the valley floor has some protection from possible frost damage. The grapes ripen one after the other to spread the harvesting.{The wine}is made in the traditional way and matured in oak casks especially made and imported from Bordeaux. The wines have a character all their own, and two{ciders}and a perry are also made at Yearlstone; they are labelled in the old English - Cyder.
